summary: The West Bank Violence Prevention Act of 2025 authorizes the President to impose sanctions on foreign persons who threaten peace, security, or stability in the West Bank through violent acts. These sanctions include asset blocking and ineligibility for US visas and admission. The President must report to Congress regularly on the implementation of the act, including the names of sanctioned individuals, descriptions of their actions, and any waivers granted. Exceptions are made for authorized intelligence activities, humanitarian assistance, and compliance with international obligations and law enforcement. The bill defines key terms like "person," "entity," and "terrorism."
